published_date.description: The date the object was published in Onyx.

site.description: The site or sequencing centre providing the data.

climb_id.description: Unique identifier for a project record in Onyx.

biosample_id.description: The sequencing provider's identifier for a sample.

biosample_source_id.description: Unique identifier for an individual to permit multiple samples from the same individual to be linked.

run_id.description: Unique identifier assigned to the run by the sequencing instrument.

platform.description: The platform used to sequence the data.

specimen_type_details.description: Named control or standard for specimens.

control_type_details.description: Named control or standard for positive and negative controls.

sample_source.description: The source from which the sample was collected.

sample_type.description: The type of sampling method used.

spike_in.description: The type of spike-in used in the run.

spike_in_result.description: Result assigned by scylla for the provided spike-in.

collection_date.description: The date the sample was collected.
restrictions: At least one required: collection_date, received_date

received_date.description: The date the sample was received by the sequencing centre (if collection_date unavailable).
restrictions: At least one required: collection_date, received_date

is_approximate_date.description: The date is approximate e.g. the sample is from a public repository and it is unclear whether the date corresponds to collection or publishing.

batch_id.description: Used to identify samples prepared in the same laboratory batch (e.g. extraction, library and/or sequencing).

study_id.description: Used to identify study or if NHS residual sample.

sequence_purpose.description: Used to differentiate between clinical or research studies.

governance_status.description: Did the patient consent to their sample being used for research purposes or not.

iso_country.description: Country that the sample was collected in, using ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 codes (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2), unless within United Kingdom. If so, use ISO-3166-2:GB (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2:GB).

iso_region.description: Region that the sample was collected in, using the second level subdivision codes of ISO-3166-2:GB (https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:code:3166:GB).

extraction_enrichment_protocol.description: Details of nucleic acid extraction and optional enrichment steps.

protocol_arm.description: Used to indicate arm for protocols which have separate arms for bacterial and viral nucleic acids.

bioinformatics_protocol.description: Detail of initial bioinformatics protocol, for example versions of basecalling software and models used, any read quality filtering/trimming employed.

dehumanisation_protocol.description: Details of bioinformatics method used for human read removal.

is_public_dataset.description: The sample is from a public dataset. Please only set this after it has been made public.

public_database_name.description: The public repository where the data is.

public_database_accession.description: The accession for the data in the public database.

ingest_report.description: HTML report summarising the read profile and taxa identified.

taxon_reports.description: Folder of all classification output files.

human_filtered_reads_1.description: Compressed FASTQ of input reads that have been filtered for human reads.

human_filtered_reads_2.description: Compressed FASTQ of input reads that have been filtered for human reads.

unclassified_reads_1.description: Compressed FASTQ of input reads which could not be classified.

unclassified_reads_2.description: Compressed FASTQ of input reads which could not be classified.

viral_reads_1.description: Compressed FASTQ of input reads which were classified as viral.

viral_reads_2.description: Compressed FASTQ of input reads which were classified as viral.

viral_and_unclassified_reads_1.description: Compressed FASTQ of input reads which were classified as viral or were unclassified.

viral_and_unclassified_reads_2.description: Compressed FASTQ of input reads which were classified as viral or were unclassified.

total_bases.description: Total number of bases in the input FASTQ file(s), before any filtering.

ncbi_taxonomy_date.description: Date that the NCBI taxonomy dump was produced.

scylla_version.description: Version of the scylla pipeline used.

chimera_bam.description: BAM file of the human filtered read fraction aligned to the zeus database.

is_chimera_published.description: Whether chimera has been run on this record or not.

alignment_db_version.description: Version of the Zeus database used.

sylph_db_version.description: Sylph database version utilised to produce Sylph classifications.

source_climb_id.description: CLIMB ID of the record used as a base dataset.

spiked_ids.description: JSON list of taxon ids included in the spike-in.

taxa_files.description: Table of all species level taxa extracted by the Scylla ingest pipeline.

taxon_id.description: The NCBI taxonomy id associated with the taxa.

human_readable.description: A human readable name for the taxa.

n_reads.description: The number of reads extracted for the taxa.

total_bases.description: Total number of bases extracted for the taxa.

avg_quality.description: The mean quality of reads extracted for the taxa.

mean_len.description: The mean length of reads extracted for the taxa.

fastq_1.description: Compressed FASTQ of extracted reads for the taxa.

fastq_2.description: Compressed FASTQ of extracted reads for the taxa.

classifier_calls.description: Table summarising the NCBI taxonomy ids, counts and ranks of all taxa found by the classifier during the Scylla ingest pipeline.

taxon_id.description: The NCBI taxonomy id associated with the taxa.

human_readable.description: A human readable name for the taxa.

percentage.description: The percentage of the (dehumanised) sample that the taxa represents.

count_descendants.description: The number of reads mapping to this taxa and all descendant taxa.

count_direct.description: The number of reads mapping directly to the taxa.

raw_rank.description: The rank of the taxa including an intermediate grading.

spike_in_info.description: Table containing results found for the provided spike-in.

taxon_id.description: The NCBI taxonomy id associated with the taxa.

human_readable.description: A human readable name for the taxa.

reference_header.description: Reference header for the individual sequence within the provided spike-in.

mapped_count.description: Number of reads which aligned to a reference sequence for the provided spike-in.

alignment_results.description: Table containing alignment results from the viral alignment stage of the CLIMB-TRE/chimera pipeline.

taxon_id.description: The NCBI taxonomy id associated with the taxa.

human_readable.description: Human readable scientific name for the taxa.

unique_accession.description: Unique reference identifier in the alignment database (everything prior to the first whitespace in the FASTA header).

accession_description.description: The comment for the reference sequence within the alignment database.

sequence_length.description: Length of the reference sequence in the alignment database.

evenness_value.description: A percentage indicating how evenly read depths are distributed throughout the reference, with 0 being completely uneven, and 100 being perfectly even. Taken from https://academic.oup.com/nar/article/38/10/e116/2902812, under the “Calculation of evenness score” section, and calculated here: https://github.com/CLIMB-TRE/chimera/blob/dca3cacb949dabc902d0a12e5d11d36c6ac555fd/bin/generate_alignment_report.py#L102.

mean_depth.description: Mean of all depth values across the alignment reference.

coverage_1x.description: Percentage of the reference sequence covered with a depth of at least 1x.

coverage_10x.description: Percentage of the reference covered with a depth of at least 10x.

mapped_reads.description: Total number of reads mapped to the alignment reference.

uniquely_mapped_reads.description: Total number of reads which uniquely map to each reference sequence, calculated for each reference sequence here: https://github.com/CLIMB-TRE/chimera/blob/bca6fe6fe293f8e56d9e70627a846dda6f3d886a/bin/generate_alignment_report.py#L59-L82.

mapped_bases.description: Approximation for the total number of bases mapped to the alignment reference, calculated from the length of the reference sequence multiplied by the mean depth of alignments to that reference.

mean_read_identity.description: Mean of read identities across all alignments. Can be considered an approximation for identity of the source genome with the reference sequence. Calculated for each read here: https://github.com/CLIMB-TRE/chimera/blob/dca3cacb949dabc902d0a12e5d11d36c6ac555fd/bin/generate_alignment_report.py#L58

read_duplication_rate.description: What proportion of the reads start and end in the same alignment reference position as at least one other read within the alignment. Calculated here: https://github.com/CLIMB-TRE/chimera/blob/dca3cacb949dabc902d0a12e5d11d36c6ac555fd/bin/generate_alignment_report.py#L76-L83

forward_proportion.description: Proportion of reads which aligned to the forward strand. Between 0 and 1, with 0 indicating all reads aligned to the reverse strand, 1 the opposite. True hits should be close to 0.5 for this value for any reasonable mean depth.

mean_read_length.description: Mean read length (inferred from CIGAR string) of all reads aligned to the reference sequence in question.

mean_alignment_length.description: Mean length of all alignments to the reference - different to mean read length aligned to the reference, since it only considers the aligned section of the reads.

mean_alignment_proportion.description: Mean of the proportion of each read which makes up the alignment to the reference (functionally mean_alignment_length / mean_read_length)

sylph_results.description: Table containing sylph results from the Sylph classification stage of the CLIMB-TRE/chimera pipeline.

taxon_id.description: The NCBI taxonomy id associated with the taxa.

human_readable.description: Human readable scientific name for the taxa.

gtdb_taxon_string.description: Description of the taxonomic placement of the source contig within the Sylph database using GTDBs taxon string format.

gtdb_assembly_id.description: Assembly ID (often genbank accession) for the contig within the sylph database, taken from GTDB.

gtdb_contig_header.description: From the origin FASTA record header as it appears in GTDB. Identical to 'Contig_name' field in sylph profile output.

taxonomic_abundance.description: Normalized taxonomic abundance as a percentage. Identical to 'Taxonomic_abundance' in sylph profile output.

sequence_abundance.description: Normalized sequence abundance as a percentage. Identical to 'Sequence_abundance' in sylph profile output.

adjusted_ani.description: If coverage adjustment is possible (cov is < 3x cov): returns coverage-adjusted ANI (Average Nucleotide Identity). If coverage is too low/high: returns naive_ani. Identical to 'Adjusted_ANI' in sylph profile output.

ani_confidence_interval.description: [5%,95%] confidence intervals. If coverage adjustment is possible: float-float e.g. 98.52-99.55. If coverage is too low/high: NA-NA is given. Identical to 'ANI_5-95_percentile' field in sylph profile output.

effective_coverage.description: Estimated 'λeff' value, true value is not calculated, this is estimated based on kmers. More information is available in the sylph paper: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41587-024-02412-y. If coverage adjustment is possible, lambda estimate is given. Identical to 'Eff_cov' field in sylph profile output.

effective_coverage_confidence_interval.description: [5%, 95%] confidence intervals for lambda. Same format rules as 'ani_confidence_interval'. Identical to 'Lambda_5-95_percentile' field in sylph profile output.

median_kmer_cov.description: Median k-mer multiplicity for k-mers with >= 1 multiplicity. Identical to 'Median_cov' field in sylph profile output.

mean_kmer_cov.description: Mean k-mer multiplicity for k-mers with >= 1 multiplicity. Identical to 'Mean_cov_geq1' field in sylph profile output.

containment_index.description: int/int showing the containment index (number of k-mers found in sample divided by total k-mers), e.g. 959/1053. Identical to 'Containment_ind' field in sylph profile output.

naive_ani.description: Containment ANI without coverage adjustment. Identical to 'Naive_ANI' field in sylph profile output.

kmers_reassigned.description: The number of k-mers reassigned away from the genome. Identical to 'Kmers_reassigned' field in sylph profile output.
